Split a string using a delimiter and trim the resulting two strings

Parameters:
in The string to be split

left (updated) pointer to a string that gets the trimmed part to the left of (before) the delimiter
right (updated) pointer to a string that gets the trimmed part to the right of (after) the delimiter 
00047 {
00048     string::size_type p = in.find(match);
00049     if (p == in.npos) {
00050         *left = trim(in);
00051         *right = "";
00052     } else {
00053         *left = trim(in.substr(0, p));
00054         *right = trim(in.substr(p+1));
00055     }
00056 }

void tokenizeStr (  const string &  in,
vector< string > &  tokens
) 
 

Tokenize a string into a vector of tokens, using blanks and tabs for delimiters

Parameters:
in The string to tokenize
tokens (updated) a vector of strings (the tokens) 
00064 {
00065     string str = in;
00066     const string splitters = " \t";
00067     tokens.clear();
00068     while (str.length() > 0) {
00069         string::size_type p = str.find_first_not_of(splitters);
00070         if (p == str.npos) {
00071             break;
00072         }
00073         string::size_type p2 = str.find_first_of(splitters, p);
00074         if (p2 == str.npos) {
00075             tokens.push_back(str.substr(p));
00076             break;
00077         }
00078         tokens.push_back(str.substr(p, p2-p));
00079         str = str.substr(p2);
00080     }
00081 }

Parameters:

Returns:

00027 {
00028     string::size_type p0 = in.find_first_not_of(" ");
00029     if (p0 == string::npos) {
00030         return "";
00031     }
00032     string::size_type p2 = in.find_last_not_of(" ");
00033     return in.substr(p0, p2-p0+1);
00034 }
